item.title: MTP - A multi world server
item.dc:creator: @_bool
item.description:
@_bool wrote:

[quote=“jmood128, post:41, topic:335750”][quote author=(Anthony) link=topic=432131.msg3175762#msg3175762 date=1270837389]

I should also suggest if your using a Wl base, that you crash patch it, if you do it will also make your server not brake any copy right laws with jagex due to server code.

Except for that if you agreed to the terms of service you agreed NOT to make server emulators which make any server you make illegal no matter what. (Unless of course you didn’t agree to the terms of service, in which case you just can’t touch the client.)

And the stream class is still ripped from the client.
[/quote]

When you crash patch it, its not ripped from a client. the stream and cryption class used in the crash patch fix is written by us and not a from a jagex Deob.[/quote]
I was pretty sure he only replaced the Cryption class(As it had vulnerabilities) and caught a few exceptions.

marcbob:

Ya technically if we had a txt document in the client folder that said TOS and we put a bunch of stuff so we couldnt be sued

What the fuck would that do…

Read full topic

item.title: MTP - A multi world server
item.dc:creator: @_bool
item.description:
@_bool wrote:

King_Zuber:

Well i think if you make all of the servers load and save from 1 directory, then it will be much easier to run them all. Another idea maybe is to make a world selection page out of a custom interface, but make sure you don’t host to many at the same time.

They are going to be able to run on separate computers and link.

Read full topic
